title: Transport & Driving License - New In Abu Dhabi

content.text: Transport & Driving License

Confused about transport in Abu Dhabi? This guide helps newcomers navigate public buses, bus cards, and taxi apps to get around with ease. Learn about UAE driving license rules, including Golden Chance, and discover trusted driving schools for license conversion.
Public Transport in Abu Dhabi
1. Hafilat Card – Bus Transport Pass
Rechargeable card used on public buses
Can be bought at bus stations, kiosks, or recharged online
Cost: AED 10 (initial) + recharge as needed

You can recharge your Hafilat card online via the Darbi website and app. Physical top-up locations include Darbi machines at bus stations and malls. You can also recharge at all branches of LuLu Hypermarket and Abu Dhabi Cooperative Society.
2. Where to Catch Buses
Main Bus Station: Al Wahda Bus Terminal
Feeder stops in Muroor, Electra, Mussafah, Baniyas
All buses are air-conditioned and run on time
3. Free & Discounted Rides
Seniors, people of determination, and students may get discounts
Apply via Darb app or customer happiness center

Your Situation
What to Do
You hold a license from a recognized country (UK, EU, GCC, US, Canada, etc.)
Apply for conversion at TAMM or Abu Dhabi Licensing Center
You have a valid license from an unrecognized country
Take the “Golden Chance” test — one direct road test only
You fail the Golden Chance or never drove before
Enroll in driving classes at Emirates Driving Company
You want women-only training
Emirates Driving Company has ladies-only courses
What is the Golden Chance Test?
The Golden Chance is a one-time direct road test offered to drivers who hold a license from countries not eligible for conversion.
No driving classes required
If you pass: you get your UAE license
If you fail: you must join full driving school program
Fee: approx. AED 2,200–3,000 including registration and road test
Available at Emirates Driving Company – Mussafah
